org.xlattice.corexml.bind

Class Seq

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.corexml.bind.Ordering
      • org.xlattice.corexml.bind.Seq

  • public class Seq
extends Ordering
    Represents a set of bindings (Joins) to be applied in serial order (in sequence). Each Join is between
    • an XML attribute or element
    • and a field in an object
    The translation can be run in either direction. An apply call will run down the list of Joins, using each in turn to extract values from XML and then either assign values to object fields or create instances of Java objects. This is done recursively, potentially creating a tree of such objects. A generate call has the opposite effect: it applies the Joins in sequence to a Java object and any children, extracting values which are assigned to XML nodes or used to create such nodes.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

      • apply

        protected void apply(Element elm,
         java.lang.Object obj)
              throws CoreXmlException
        Use the ordering to generate a set of values from the children of an Element, recursing if possible. The values obtained will be used to set fields in the object, and/or instantiate child objects.
        Specified by:
        apply in class Ordering
        Parameters:
        elm - Element whose children values come from
        obj - object in which values are assigned
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException

      • generate

        protected void generate(Element elm,
            java.lang.Object o)
                 throws CoreXmlException
        Use the ordering to create XML nodes. The ordering is used to draw values from the object and, if they are present, from children of the object. These values are used to set attributes in the Element, subelement values, and so on recursively.
        Specified by:
        generate in class Ordering
        Parameters:
        elm - the Element the generated XML gets hung from
        o - the object values are drawn from
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException
